source_sentence: 佛說佛母出生三法藏般若
translation: Prajñāpāramitā of the Three Sources of the Dharma Treasury Spoken by the Buddha to the Buddha's Mother

source_sentence: 波羅蜜多經卷第二十五
translation: Perfection of Wisdom Sutra, Volume 25

source_sentence: 西天譯經三藏朝奉大夫試光祿卿
translation: Xitian zhuan jing sanzang朝奉大夫試光祿卿

source_sentence: 傳法大師賜紫臣施護奉　詔譯
translation: Translated by imperial edict of the Master Zhuanfa, who bestowed a purple minister named Shi Hufeng

source_sentence: 常啼菩薩品第三十之三
translation: The Thirty-third and Third Part of the Chapter of the Bodhisattva Ever Wailing

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩與長者女及諸侍女父母眷屬等，導從圍繞，并持種種珍寶供具入眾香城，
translation: At that time the great bodhisattva Mahāsattva Ever Wailing, accompanied by the elderly maidens, their attendants, their mothers, their children, and their retinues, entered the city of fragrance with various precious offerings.

source_sentence: 一心渴仰欲見法上菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: With one mind, he longs to see the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who's above the Dharma.

source_sentence: 是時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩等既入城已，詣菩薩所其去不遠，常啼菩薩摩訶薩見帝釋天主與無數百千天子，
translation: At that time the great bodhisattva Ever Wailing, having entered the city, approached the enlightening being. Not far from it, the great bodhisattva Ever Wailing saw Śakra Devānām-Indra and innumerable hundreds of thousands of other celestial beings.

source_sentence: 散天曼陀羅華、摩訶曼陀羅華及餘種種殊妙天華、天金銀華等散於虛空，
translation: They scattered celestial maṇḍala flowers, mahāmandārava flowers, as well as various other exquisite celestial flowers and heavenly gold and silver flowers in the sky.

source_sentence: 及散栴檀香末，又復廣作微妙天樂，其所散華住在空中。
translation: He spreads sandalwood powder and creates a wide variety of subtle celestial music, and the flowers he spreads live in the sky.

source_sentence: 常啼菩薩摩訶薩，如是見已，即問帝釋天主言：『憍尸迦！
translation: After seeing it this way, the Ever Wailing Bodhisattva Mahāsattva asked Śakra Devānām-Indra,'Kauśika!

source_sentence: 汝何緣故於虛空中與無數百千天子，散眾天華及散栴檀香末，廣作天樂？』
translation: What is the reason why you scattered hundreds of thousands of celestial flowers and powdered sandalwood incense in the sky with countless hundreds of thousands of celestial beings to create a great deal of heavenly music?'

source_sentence: 帝釋天主白常啼菩薩摩訶薩言：『善男子！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said to the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 汝不知耶？
translation: Don't you know?

source_sentence: 有法名摩訶般若波羅蜜多，是諸佛母亦是諸菩薩母。
translation: There's a teaching named Mahāprajñāpāramitā, which is the mother of buddhas and the mother of bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 學是法者即能成就一切智，圓滿一切佛功德法。
translation: Those who study this teaching will then be able to achieve omniscience and perfect all the buddhas' virtuous qualities.

source_sentence: 汝今當知！
translation: You should now know!

source_sentence: 於法上菩薩摩訶薩演說法處，別有七寶臺高廣妙好種種嚴飾，真珠寶網間錯垂布，
translation: At the place where the supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva taught the Dharma there was another seven-jeweled terrace, high and wide, beautifully decorated in various ways, draped with networks of genuine jewels.

source_sentence: 於其臺中有七寶床，而彼床上安七寶函，以黃金鍱書是摩訶般若波羅蜜多正法置於函內，
translation: On that platform there was a seven-jeweled couch, and on that couch was a seven-jeweled casket. The golden lettering “This is the true teaching of the Great Perfection of Wisdom scripture” was placed inside the casket.

source_sentence: 種種珍寶周匝圍繞，其臺四角安四白銀香爐，燒黑沈水香，供養摩訶般若波羅蜜多正法。
translation: Surrounded by various precious treasures, the four corners of the throne are surrounded by four white silver incense burners that burn the scent of black sunken water to offer support to the true teaching of the Mahāprajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 以是緣故，我等諸天於虛空中散華供養。』
translation: For this reason, we gods scatter flowers in the sky to make offerings.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩白帝釋天主言：『憍尸迦！
translation: At the time, the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva said to Śakra Devānām-Indra,'Kauśika!

source_sentence: 如汝所說，是諸佛母及菩薩母摩訶般若波羅蜜多正法，微妙甚深最上希有，
translation: As you say, this is the true teaching of the mothers of buddhas and bodhisattvas, the mothers of the great prajñāpāramitā, subtle, profound, and most rare.

source_sentence: 汝以方便可能示我？』
translation: Are you able to show me with skillful means?'

source_sentence: 帝釋天主言：『善男子！
translation: Śakra Devānām-Indra said, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 彼摩訶般若波羅蜜多正法在七寶函內，彼法上菩薩摩訶薩以七寶印印之，
translation: The true teaching of the Mahāprajñāpāramitā-pāramitā is inside a seven-jeweled casket, and the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva seals it with a seven-jeweled mudrā.

source_sentence: 我無方便可能示汝。』
translation: I have no skillful means to show it to you.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩與長者女等，漸復前行到法上菩薩摩訶薩所。
translation: At the time, the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva and the elderly woman gradually went on their way to the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva's place.

source_sentence: 即以所持金銀珍寶、衣服臥具、幢幡寶蓋、香華燈塗等，分作二分，先持一分而共供養摩訶般若波羅蜜多，
translation: That is, the treasures of gold, silver, jewelry, clothing, bedding, banners, pennants, jeweled canopies, incense, flowers, lamps, and so forth that they hold are divided into two parts. First, they preserve one part and together make offerings to the Mahāprajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 次持一分亦共供養法上菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: The next part of the dhāraṇī also jointly makes offerings to the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 作是供養已，復以種種妙色香華向法上菩薩摩訶薩所而用散擲。
translation: After making this offering, he also scattered various kinds of exquisitely colored incense and flowers to the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva with various kinds of fragrant flowers.

source_sentence: 以法上菩薩摩訶薩威神力故，其所散華於菩薩上住虛空中，變成種種妙寶樓閣，
translation: Because of the great spiritual power of the supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva Supreme Dharma, the flowers he scattered rose up into the sky above the enlightening being and became towers of various beautiful jewels.

source_sentence: 是諸樓閣自然皆有真珠瓔珞間錯垂布。
translation: Each of these towers naturally has genuine pearls, jewelry, and draped cloth.

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩并長者女見是相已，咸作是念：『善哉！
translation: At the time, the Ever Wailing Bodhisattva Mahāsattva and the elderly woman saw this sign and thought, 'Good!'

source_sentence: 此相甚為希有。
translation: This mark is very rare.

source_sentence: 法上菩薩摩訶薩現住菩薩地，神通威德尚能如是，何況成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提已，
translation: The supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva of the Dharma manifestly abides in the bodhisattva-stage, and his supernormal powers and authoritative qualities can still be like this. How much the more so after he has perfected unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment!

source_sentence: 彼諸功德不可稱計。』
translation: Their merits can't be measured.'

source_sentence: 爾時長者女作是念已，於法上菩薩摩訶薩，益加恭敬尊重愛樂，并五百侍女亦各恭敬尊重愛樂。
translation: After the elder woman had this thought, the bodhisattva Mahāsattva of the Dharma Supreme paid increasing respect and veneration to them, and each of the five hundred maidservants also paid respect and veneration to them.

source_sentence: 時長者女及五百侍女，皆發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，咸作是言：『願我以此善根因緣，
translation: The elder woman and the five hundred maidservants then all aroused the aspiration for highest, complete enlightenment. They all said, “May this be the cause and condition for my attaining enlightenment:

source_sentence: 於未來世當得成佛。
translation: In the future, he'll become a buddha.

source_sentence: 為菩薩時亦如法上菩薩摩訶薩，愛樂尊重般若波羅蜜多等無有異，及廣為人宣說般若波羅蜜多，
translation: When he's a bodhisattva, it's also like the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva who loves and venerates the perfection of prajñāpāramitā and so forth without distinction, and he explains the perfection of prajñāpāramitā to people in detail.

source_sentence: 成就般若波羅蜜多善巧方便，皆如法上菩薩摩訶薩今日無異。』
translation: Accomplishing the skillful means of the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, they're all like the bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas above the Dharma today without any difference.'

source_sentence: 作是言已，彼長者女并五百侍女，即時頭面禮菩薩足。
translation: After he said this, the elder's daughter and five hundred maidservants bowed their heads and faces at the Bodhisattva's feet.

source_sentence: 禮已，合掌退住一面。
translation: After paying homage, he joined his palms and withdrew to one side.

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩如前所作供養事已，即時頭面禮菩薩足。
translation: After making the offerings as before, the Ever Wailing Bodhisattva Mahāsattva then bowed his head and face to the bodhisattva's feet.

source_sentence: 禮已旋繞種種稱讚，歡喜瞻仰合掌而住。
translation: After paying homage, he circled around and praised them in various ways, joined his palms with joy and veneration, and stood there.

source_sentence: 問法上菩薩摩訶薩言：『大士！
translation: He asked the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva, 'Great man!

source_sentence: 當知我善因緣故來至此。
translation: You should know that I came here because of good causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 我本為求般若波羅蜜多故，於空寂林中思惟方便，時空中有聲而謂我言：「汝可東行求般若波羅蜜多。」
translation: Originally, I was contemplating skillful means in the forest of emptiness and quiescence because I wanted to pursue the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, and then a voice rose up in the air and said to me, You may go east to seek the perfection of prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 我如所教尋即東行，東行未久我復作念：「向者云何而不能問彼空中聲，
translation: Soon after going eastward, I thought to myself: “How is it that you can’t ask me about the sound in the sky?

source_sentence: 東行遠近？
translation: How far away is it from the east?

source_sentence: 於何方處從誰得聞般若波羅蜜多？」
translation: Where and from whom can I hear the perfection of wisdom?

source_sentence: 我於爾時憂愁啼泣，即於彼住經七晝夜。
translation: At the time, I was grieved and wept, and for seven days and nights I stayed there.

source_sentence: 當是憂愁啼泣之時，忽然見有如來形像，住於我前作如是言：「善男子！
translation: When he was weeping with grief, he suddenly saw an image of the Tathāgata standing in front of me and said, Good man!

source_sentence: 從是東行五百由旬有城名眾香，彼有菩薩摩訶薩名曰法上。
translation: From here going eastward for five hundred yojanas, there's a city named Sangha Fragrance, where there's a bodhisattva Mahāsattva named Dharma上.

source_sentence: 汝可往彼，當得聞般若波羅蜜多。」
translation: You can go there and hear the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 我時聞是說已心大歡喜，即於彼處一心諦想大士，思惟般若波羅蜜多。
translation: After hearing this teaching, my mind was greatly joyful, and I then concentrated on that place, singlemindedly conceived as a great person, contemplated the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, and thought about it.

source_sentence: 我於爾時住一切法無依止想，即時得入無量無數三摩地門，於三摩地中，
translation: At that point, while I was abiding in the perception of all things as non-dependent, I instantly entered measureless and countless approaches to concentration.

source_sentence: 見十方無量阿僧祇世界諸佛如來、應供、正等正覺，各各為諸菩薩摩訶薩宣說般若波羅蜜多。
translation: Seeing the buddhas, tathāgatas, Worthy of Offerings, and Completely Enlightened Ones of measureless incalculable worlds in the ten directions, they each taught the perfection of prajñāpāramitā for the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and enlightening beings.

source_sentence: 是諸如來咸讚我言：「善哉，善哉！
translation: These tathāgatas all praised me, saying, Good, good!

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝以求般若波羅蜜多因緣故，得入諸三摩地門。」
translation: Because you seek the causes and conditions for the perfection of wisdom, you'll be able to enter the gate of samādhi.

source_sentence: 時諸如來如是乃至種種示教利喜，安慰我已，忽然不現。
translation: The Tathāgatas then did so and variously taught, benefited, and delighted me, comforted me, and suddenly disappeared.

source_sentence: 我於爾時從三摩地出已，不復得見諸佛如來。
translation: After I emerged from samādhi at that point, I couldn't see the buddha-tathāgatas again.

source_sentence: 我心苦惱即作是念：「向者如來，從何所來？
translation: My mind was pained and distressed, and I thought, Where did the Tathāgata come from?

source_sentence: 去至何所？」
translation: Where will you go?

source_sentence: 我復思惟：「彼法上菩薩摩訶薩，於先佛所深種善根，通達般若波羅蜜多具諸方便，
translation: Again, I thought: That supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva of the Dharma deeply planted roots of goodness in the presence of former buddhas and comprehended the perfection of wisdom with skillful means.

source_sentence: 我當往彼聽受般若波羅蜜多及問斯義。」
translation: I will go there to hear the prajñāpāramitā and ask about its meaning.

source_sentence: 以是緣故我今至此，而得瞻禮菩薩大士。
translation: Because of these reasons, I've come here now to pay homage to the bodhisattva and great man.

source_sentence: 我心歡喜深自慶快，猶如苾芻得第三禪樂。
translation: My heart is joyous and profoundly happy, like a monk who has attained the bliss of the third dhyāna.

source_sentence: 大士！
translation: Great man!

source_sentence: 如我向於三摩地中所見如來，而不知彼從何所來？
translation: It's like when I saw the Tathāgata in samādhi and didn't know where he came from?

source_sentence: 去至何所？
translation: Where will it go?

source_sentence: 唯願大士示教於我，令我常得見佛世尊。』
translation: Please let the great man show and teach me so that I can always see the Bhagavān.'

source_sentence: 法上菩薩品第三十一
translation: Chapter 31 of the Dharma Supreme Bodhisattva

source_sentence: 「爾時，法上菩薩摩訶薩謂常啼菩薩摩訶薩言：『善男子！
translation: At the time, the Dharma Supreme Bodhisattva Mahāsattva addressed the Ever Wailing Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, saying, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 如來者，無所從來亦無所去。
translation: The Tathāgata has no source and no destination.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 真如無動，真如即是如來。
translation: The true thusness is unmoving, and the true thusness is the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 不生法無來無去，不生法即是如來。
translation: The Dharma that doesn't arise has no coming and no going, and the Dharma that doesn't arise is the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 實際無來無去，實際即是如來。
translation: The actuality has neither coming nor going, and the actuality is the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 空性無來無去，空性即是如來。
translation: The nature of emptiness has no coming and no going, and the nature of emptiness is the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 無染法無來無去，無染法即是如來。
translation: The undefiled dharmas have no coming and no going, and the undefiled dharmas are the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 寂滅無來無去，寂滅即是如來。
translation: Tranquil extinction has no coming and no going, and tranquil extinction is the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 虛空無來無去，虛空即是如來。
translation: Space has no coming and no going, and space is the Tathāgata.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 離如是等法，無別有法可名如來。
translation: Apart from such things, there's no separate dharma that can be called a tathāgata.

source_sentence: 此復云何所謂如來真如？
translation: What else is this so-called true thusness of the Tathāgata?

source_sentence: 一切法真如，同是一真如，是如無分別、無二亦無三。
translation: The true nature of all dharmas is the same as one true nature, which is thus without distinction, without duality, and without three.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 譬如春末夏初，於日中分陽焰動發，若時有人於中求水，於汝意云何，
translation: “Furthermore, if someone asks for water at the end of spring and the beginning of summer, what do you think?

source_sentence: 彼水從何所來？
translation: Where did that water come from?

source_sentence: 為從東海來耶？
translation: Does it come from the eastern sea?

source_sentence: 南西北海來耶？
translation: Did it come from the south, west, and north?

source_sentence: 其去亦然。』
translation: So it is with his departure.'

source_sentence: 常啼菩薩言：『彼陽焰中無水可得，況復有來及有去耶？
translation: The eternally wailing bodhisattva said, 'There's no water to be found in that mirage, so why wouldn't there be any coming or going?'

source_sentence: 但是愚癡無智虛妄所見。』
translation: It's just a false view of foolishness and ignorance.'

source_sentence: 法上菩薩言：『善男子！
translation: The Dharma Supreme Bodhisattva said, 'Good sons!

source_sentence: 一切如來亦復如是。
translation: So it is with all the tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 若人著於色相及以音聲，觀諸如來若來若去起分別者，當知是人愚癡無智虛妄所見。
translation: If someone is attached to form and sounds and observes the tathāgatas coming and going and making distinctions, you should know that they're foolish and ignorant, have no knowledge, and are falsely seen.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 如來者是即法身，非色身可見。
translation: The Tathāgata is the Dharma body, not a form body that can be seen.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 法性無來無去，一切如來亦復如是無來無去。
translation: The Dharma nature has neither coming nor going, and so do all the tathāgatas have neither coming nor going.

source_sentence: 又如幻師幻化所作象兵、馬兵、車兵、步兵，如是四兵幻所作故無來無去。
translation: It's also like an illusionist who creates elephant troops, horse troops, chariot troops, and foot troops that are illusorily created by the four armies, so there's neither coming nor going.

source_sentence: 一切如來亦復如是，無來無去。
translation: So it is with all the Tathāgatas, who have neither coming nor going.

source_sentence: 又如有人於其夢中，或見一佛二佛三四五佛乃至百千諸佛。
translation: It's also like a person who in their dream sees one Buddha, two buddhas, three, four, five, or even a hundred thousand buddhas.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 而彼諸佛從何所來？
translation: Where did those buddhas come from?

source_sentence: 去至何所？』
translation: Where will you go?'

source_sentence: 常啼菩薩言：『大士！
translation: The Ever Wailing Bodhisattva said, 'Great man!

source_sentence: 夢所不實，無決定法，於是法中何有去來？』
translation: What's not real in a dream has no definite dharma, so how could there be going or coming in that dharma?'

source_sentence: 法上菩薩言：『一切如來亦復如是。
translation: The Dharma Supreme Bodhisattva said, 'So it is with all the tathāgatas.'

source_sentence: 如佛所說，一切法如夢。
translation: As the Buddha said, all dharmas are like dreams.

source_sentence: 有人不能如實了知一切法如夢故，即以色相音聲語言名字，執著分別諸佛如來若來若去。
translation: Some people can't truly know all dharmas as dreams, which is to say that they cling to the names of form and sounds and words in order to discriminate between the buddha-tathāgatas who come and go.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 若於是法中不如實知虛妄分別者，當知是等名愚異生，受生死身輪轉諸趣，
translation: If someone doesn't really know the false distinctions in those teachings, they should know that such people are called foolish and unenlightened sentient beings who experience birth-and-death body transmigration in various destinies.

source_sentence: 遠離般若波羅蜜多，遠離一切佛法。
translation: He's far removed from the perfection of wisdom and far removed from all the buddha-teachings.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 若人如實了知，如佛所說一切法如夢，於是法中即無有法若來若去，是故無所分別。
translation: If someone truly understands all the teachings taught by the Buddha as they are like dreams, then there's no teaching in those teachings that comes or goes, so there's no discrimination.

source_sentence: 如實了知一切如來無來無去不生不滅，如是知者，是為見法，是為知法，
translation: To truly know all buddhas as they really are, without coming or going, neither arising nor ceasing—and to know them in this way is to see the Dharma. This is knowledge of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 是人即近阿耨多羅三藐菩提，是行般若波羅蜜多，不虛受其國中信施，
translation: That person then approaches unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, practices the perfection of wisdom, and doesn't falsely accept the faithful offerings of his country.

source_sentence: 能與世間作大福田。
translation: They can create a great field of merit with the world.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 又如大海出種種寶，是寶不從東方而來，亦復不從南西北方四維上下諸方而來，
translation: “Furthermore, just as the ocean produces various kinds of precious substances that do not come from the east, so they do not come from the south, west, north, south, or in all directions.

source_sentence: 但是一切眾生所作福業共感報應。
translation: But all sentient beings perform meritorious actions that are commonly rewarded.

source_sentence: 是故大海出諸珍寶，是寶一一從因緣生，亦不無因緣生。
translation: That's why the ocean produces rare treasures, and each of these treasures arise from causes and conditions, but they don't arise without causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 因緣和合即有，因緣散滅即無。
translation: The conjunction of causes and conditions is existence, and the disintegration of causes and conditions is nonexistence.

source_sentence: 有亦不從十方來，無亦不至十方去。
translation: What's existent doesn't come from the ten directions, and what's nonexistent doesn't go to the ten directions.

source_sentence: 諸如來身亦復如是，不從十方來、不至十方去，但以因緣和合所生，不住因緣法，
translation: The body of the Buddha is also like this: it does not come from the ten directions or go to any of the ten directions. Rather, it is born of conjunction of causes and conditions; it does not abide in causality.

source_sentence: 亦不無因緣生。
translation: Nor does it arise without causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 因緣和合即生，因緣離散即滅。
translation: When causes and conditions are combined, they arise; when causes and conditions are dissociated, they perish.

source_sentence: 生亦不從十方來，滅亦不至十方去。
translation: Birth doesn't come from the ten directions, and cessation doesn't go to the ten directions.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 又如箜篌有絃有槽有棍，若人以手鼓擊出聲，是聲無所從來，不從絃出、不從槽出、不從棍出、不從手出，
translation: “Furthermore, if someone were to strike a drum with their hand and make a noise, that sound would come from nowhere. It would not come out of the drum, it would not come out of the drum, it would not come out of the drum, it would not come out of the drum, it would not come out of the drum, it would not come out of the drum, it would not

source_sentence: 但以因緣和合有聲，因緣散滅即無有聲，是聲滅已亦無所至。
translation: It is only because of the conjunction of causes and conditions that there is sound. The disappearance of causes and conditions means that there is no sound. After the disappearance of sound, there also is nowhere to be reached.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 諸佛如來亦復如是。
translation: The buddhas and tathāgatas are likewise.

source_sentence: 從一切相應善根種種因緣如理出生，非一因一緣一善根生，亦不無因緣生。
translation: The good roots associated with all [factors] are produced in accordance with the principle of manifold causes and conditions. It is not that one cause produces one root of merit by means of one condition or another, nor does it arise without causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 緣合故生，生而無來，緣散故滅，滅而無去。
translation: It arises because of the conjunction of conditions, and there is no coming when it arises; it perishes because of the dispersal of conditions, and there is no going when it perishes.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝當如是如實了知諸佛如來無來無去，若知諸佛無來去故，即住一切法無生無滅。
translation: You should thus truly know that the buddhas and tathāgatas have neither coming nor going, and if you know that the buddhas have neither coming nor going, then you'll abide in all things without arising or ceasing.

source_sentence: 如是知者，是行般若波羅蜜多善巧方便，決定得成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。』
translation: Such a knower who practices the skillful means of prajñāpāramitā will surely attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，法上菩薩摩訶薩說是諸佛如來無來無去法時，三千大千世界六種震動現十八相，
translation: “At that time the great enlightening being Supreme Dharma taught these eighteen characteristics of the buddha-teachings:

source_sentence: 所謂動、遍動、等遍動，吼、遍吼、等遍吼，震、遍震、等遍震，踊、遍踊、等遍踊，
translation: The so-called movement, pervasive movement, equal pervasive movement, roar, pervasive roar, equal pervasive roar, earthquake, pervasive earthquake, equal pervasive earthquake, dance, pervasive dance, and equal pervasive dance.

source_sentence: 爆、遍爆、等遍爆，擊、遍擊、等遍擊。
translation: Detonation, pervasive detonation, and similar pervasive detonation are struck, pervasively struck, and similarly struck.

source_sentence: 現如是等十八相已，一切魔宮隱蔽不現，非時開敷種種異華，大地一切華樹菓樹皆悉傾向法上菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: After these 18 characteristics have appeared, all the demonic palaces are concealed and not manifested, and when it's not the right time to bloom, various strange flowers arise, and all the flowers, trees, fruits, and trees on the ground all point up to the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 帝釋天主，四大天王及欲界諸天子眾，於虛空中雨天妙華，向法上菩薩摩訶薩散擲供養，
translation: Indra, the lord of the gods, the four great heavenly kings and the celestial beings of the realm of desire rained heavenly flowers from the sky to offer support to the supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 又復以諸天華散於常啼菩薩摩訶薩上，作如是言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: Again, he scattered heavenly flowers over the Ever Wailing Bodhisattva Mahāsattva and said, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 常啼菩薩！
translation: Ever wailing bodhisattva!

source_sentence: 我等因仁者故，今日於法上菩薩摩訶薩所，得聞最上甚深正法。
translation: Because of your kindness, we've heard the most profound and true teaching from the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva today.

source_sentence: 我等今日得大善利，斯為世間第一希有。』
translation: Today, we've attained great good benefits, which are the most rare in the world.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩白法上菩薩摩訶薩言：『以何因緣大地震動及現諸相？』
translation: At the time, the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva said to the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva, 'What are the causes and conditions for the great earthquake and the manifestation of its characteristics?'

source_sentence: 法上菩薩言：『善男子！
translation: The Dharma Supreme Bodhisattva said, 'Good sons!

source_sentence: 我向為汝說諸佛如來無來去法，乃有是相。』
translation: I've explained for you that the buddhas and tathāgatas have no coming or going dharma, so they have this characteristic.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，有八千人得無生法忍，八十千那庾多人發阿耨多羅三藐三菩提心，
translation: “At that time, eight thousand people attained the tolerance of the birthlessness of things. Eighty-thousand sentient beings conceived the spirit of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 六萬四千人遠塵離垢得法眼淨。
translation: Sixty-four thousand people were freed from the dust and dirt and attained purity of the Dharma eye.

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩聞是法已，心大慶快踊躍歡喜，作如是言：『我於今日得最上利，
translation: At that time the great bodhisattva Ever Wailing, having heard this teaching, was greatly joyful and ecstatic.

source_sentence: 以求般若波羅蜜多因緣故，於善知識所得聞諸佛如來無來去法。
translation: Because they seek the causes and conditions for the perfection of prajñāpāramitā, they hear from a good teacher that the buddhas and tathāgatas have no coming or going dharmas.

source_sentence: 我今已得圓滿如是善根，決定不退轉於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。』
translation: Now that I've perfected such good roots, I'm certain not to regress from unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.'

source_sentence: 作是語已轉復歡喜，踊身虛空高七多羅樹，於虛空中作是思惟：『我今復從何得上妙香華，
translation: Having uttered these words, the goddess was again delighted. Her body flew up into the sky to a height of seven thousand yojanas and thought:

source_sentence: 供養法上菩薩摩訶薩？』
translation: To make offerings to the supreme bodhisattva-mahāsattva of the Dharma?'

source_sentence: 爾時，帝釋天主知常啼菩薩心所念已，即以天曼陀羅華，奉上常啼菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: Knowing what the eternally wailing bodhisattva was thinking, Indra the lord of the gods consecrated the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva with a heavenly maṇḍala flower.

source_sentence: 天主作是言：『善男子！
translation: The lord of the gods said, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 汝可持此妙華供養法上菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: You may take this marvelous flower and offer it to the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 我今助成於汝，利益無量無數眾生。』
translation: Now, I'll help you accomplish it for the benefit of measureless and countless sentient beings.'

source_sentence: 時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩受帝釋天主所奉華已，即以此華向法上菩薩摩訶薩散擲供養。
translation: After receiving the flowers offered to him by Indra, the lord of gods, the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva then offered these flowers to the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva and scattered them as an offering.

source_sentence: 華供養已，合掌恭敬作如是言：『菩薩大士！
translation: After making the offering of flowers, he joined his palms in respect and said, 'Bodhisattva Mahāsthāmaprāpta!

source_sentence: 我從今日當以己身，奉事菩薩給侍供養。』
translation: From today, I will serve the bodhisattva with my own body and make offerings to him.'

source_sentence: 作是說已，從空中下住菩薩前。
translation: After he said this, he descended from the air and stood in front of the bodhisattva.

source_sentence: 「爾時，長者女并五百侍女俱白常啼菩薩摩訶薩言：『我等各以己身奉上於汝給侍供養，
translation: At that time, the wealthy man’s daughters and five hundred maidservants all said to the great bodhisattva Ever Wailing, “Each of us offered our own bodies to you as your offerings.

source_sentence: 并其五百乘車亦同奉上，願我世世所生，常得與汝同種善根常相值遇，
translation: May I always be born in the world like you, with the same roots of goodness as yours.

source_sentence: 常同親近諸佛菩薩恭敬供養。
translation: They'll always be together with the buddhas and bodhisattvas who venerate and make offerings to them.

source_sentence: 我所獻身願垂納受。』
translation: I wish to accept what I've offered my body.'

source_sentence: 爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩告長者女等言：『汝等若以誠心奉我，我有所行皆隨順者，
translation: It was then that the great bodhisattva Ever Wailing, addressing the elders and women, said to them, 'If you serve me with sincerity, I will follow whatever I do.

source_sentence: 我即納受。』
translation: I'll accept it.'

source_sentence: 長者女等言：『我等誠心奉上於汝，凡諸所作我等隨順。』
translation: The elders and women said, 'We sincerely submit to you, and whatever we do, we follow it.'

source_sentence: 爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩為納受已，即白法上菩薩摩訶薩言：『今此長者女并五百侍女，
translation: At that time the great bodhisattva Mahāsattva Ever Wailing, having accepted the offering, said to the supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva:

source_sentence: 乃至寶嚴五百乘車，悉迴奉上。
translation: Even the five hundred-vehicle chariots decorated with jewels were offered up in full reverence.

source_sentence: 菩薩大士願垂納受。』
translation: May the bodhisattva-mahāsattva accept it.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋天主讚常啼菩薩摩訶薩言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: At that point, the lord of Indra praised the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva, saying, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 如是喜捨甚為希有。
translation: Such joy and equanimity are rare.

source_sentence: 若菩薩摩訶薩能如是捨者，速得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，通達般若波羅蜜多善巧方便。
translation: If a bodhisattva-mahāsattva can thus abandon it, he'll quickly attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment and comprehend the skillful means of prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 過去諸佛如來、應供、正等正覺本行菩薩道時，皆如汝今行是捨行，勤求般若波羅蜜多因緣，
translation: “Furthermore, in the past buddhas who practiced the path of enlightening beings— tathagatas, pratyekabuddhas, arhats, and perfectly enlightened ones— were all engaged in this practice of relinquishment just as you are now. They diligently sought the causes and conditions for the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 亦如汝今等無有異。』
translation: It's no different from what you are now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，法上菩薩摩訶薩為欲成就常啼菩薩摩訶薩善根故，即受是長者女等。
translation: At the time, the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva wanted to accomplish the good roots of the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva because he accepted these elderly women and so forth.

source_sentence: 受已即時復與常啼菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: Immediately after receiving it, he'll again give it to the Ever Wailing Bodhisattva Mahāsattva.

source_sentence: 「爾時，法上菩薩摩訶薩，過日後分，從法座起即入宮舍。
translation: At the time, the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva rose from his Dharma seat at the end of the day and entered the palace.

source_sentence: 是時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩即作是念：『我今為求法故宜應精進，當於二事若行若立，
translation: “Then the great enlightening being Ever Wailing, then, thought: Now it is appropriate for me to make effort in order to seek the truth.

source_sentence: 待法上菩薩摩訶薩還出宮舍復登法座，我當聽受甚深正法。』
translation: 'Wait until the supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva of the Dharma returns from his palace and ascends to the Dharma seat, and I'll hear and accept the profound right teaching.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，法上菩薩摩訶薩常入般若波羅蜜多三摩地及無量無數菩薩三摩地，
translation: At the time, the supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva always entered the concentration of prajñāpāramitā and immeasurable and countless bodhisattva concentrations.

source_sentence: 於是諸三摩地中住經七歲。
translation: He then stayed in samādhi for seven years.

source_sentence: 常啼菩薩摩訶薩，亦於七歲中若行若立未嘗坐臥，不念飲食不生疲倦，
translation: The Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Ever Wailing also, even if he walks or stands for seven years without ever sitting or lying down, doesn’t think of food or drink and doesn’t become weary.

source_sentence: 但念法上菩薩摩訶薩，當於何時出三摩地還登法座？
translation: But when will the bodhisattva Mahāsattva who's mindful of the Dharma and superior, at what point will he emerge from samādhi and return to the Dharma seat?

source_sentence: 令我得聞般若波羅蜜多。
translation: It will cause me to hear the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 是時，常啼菩薩於法座所散種種華，彼長者女及五百侍女亦學常啼菩薩，
translation: At that time, the bodhisattva Ever Wailing was scattering various flowers from his seat of the Dharma. The elder’s maidservants and the five hundred maidservants were also training for the bodhisattva Ever Wailing.

source_sentence: 於七歲中若行若立未嘗坐臥，不念飲食不生疲倦，亦復一心待彼菩薩出三摩地。
translation: When he's seven years old, whether walking or standing, he never sits or lies down, doesn't think of food or drink and doesn't become weary, and he's also single-mindedly waiting for the bodhisattva to emerge from samādhi.

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩以樂法心勤精進故，忽聞空中有聲告曰：『法上菩薩後當七日出三摩地。』
translation: At the time, the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva suddenly heard a voice in the sky telling him, 'Seven days from now, the Dharma supreme bodhisattva will emerge from samādhi because he's diligently cultivating the mind that delights in the Dharma.'

source_sentence: 常啼菩薩聞是空中聲已，心大慶快踊躍歡喜，於法座所，與長者女并五百侍女，
translation: The Bodhisattva Ever Wailing, hearing the sound from the sky, was greatly joyful and ecstatic. At the seat of the Dharma, he greeted the elder’s maidservants and their five hundred attendants:

source_sentence: 以種種寶清淨嚴飾。
translation: It's adorned with various kinds of pure and beautiful treasures.

source_sentence: 時長者女等，各各脫身所著妙衣積以為座，當令法上菩薩摩訶薩安處其座。
translation: The elderly women and others then each took off their beautiful robes they had worn from their bodies to make a seat for them, and the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva was about to place them on that seat.

source_sentence: 爾時常啼菩薩即於是處周行求水為灑其地。
translation: It was then that the Ever Wailing Bodhisattva went around this place to solicit water and sprinkled it on the ground.

source_sentence: 是時諸魔隱蔽諸水悉令不現，魔作是念：『常啼菩薩求水不得心當生苦，
translation: Then the Māras concealed the water and caused it not to appear. The Māras thought, “The Bodhisattva Ever Wailing cannot obtain water;

source_sentence: 心生苦故退失道意善根不增。』
translation: Because the mind gives rise to suffering, they regress from the path and don't increase their good roots.'

source_sentence: 爾時常啼菩薩摩訶薩知是魔力所隱蔽已，即作是念：『我今應自破身出血，
translation: At that moment the great enlightening being Ever Wailing, knowing that this was to be hidden by the power of Māra, thought thus:

source_sentence: 於法座所為灑其地。
translation: He sprinkled the ground at the place where the Dharma seat was placed.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 塵土坌污菩薩當座非所清淨。
translation: The defiled bodhisattva of dust and dirt is not purified when he's seated.

source_sentence: 我今為求無上法故，設破己身何所悋惜。
translation: Now, for the sake of seeking the unsurpassed Dharma, what would I cherish if I were to break up my own body?

source_sentence: 又復，我從世世已來，以欲因緣受生死身輪轉諸趣，唐捐其功終無利益，
translation: Furthermore, from generation to generation I have undergone the physical transmigration of birth and death through various destinies for the sake of desire.

source_sentence: 不曾為此清淨法故捨自身命，是故今時宜應精進。』
translation: I've never abandoned my own life for the sake of this pure dharma; therefore, it's appropriate to make effort now.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，即執利刀破身出血而灑其地。
translation: After he had this thought, he took a sharp sword, broke his body and bled, and sprinkled it on the ground.

source_sentence: 彼長者女并五百侍女，亦學常啼菩薩，破身出血而灑其地。
translation: The elder's daughter and five hundred maidservants, who were also always crying bodhisattvas, bled and sprinkled on the ground.

source_sentence: 彼常啼菩薩并長者女等勇猛堅固，作是事已善根增長，彼諸惡魔不得其便。
translation: That constant wailing bodhisattva and the elderly women are so courageous and strong that after they do this, their good roots grow, and those bad demons won't get an advantage over them.

source_sentence: 「爾時，帝釋天主以其天眼觀是事已，即作是念：『常啼菩薩摩訶薩甚為希有，
translation: “At that time, the lord of the god Indra observed this matter with his divine eye and thought:

source_sentence: 發大勇猛被堅固鎧不惜身命，為求法故，為欲成就阿耨多羅三藐三菩提，
translation: They give rise to great courage and are armed with a strong armor, not giving up their lives. Because they seek the Teaching, they want to attain unexcelled complete perfect enlightenment.

source_sentence: 廣度一切眾生出輪迴苦，發大精進甚為希有。』
translation: To extensively liberate all sentient beings from the suffering of transmigration and give rise to great effort is rare.'

source_sentence: 帝釋天主作是念已，即令其地血所灑處，變成赤栴檀香水，面百由旬皆栴檀香。
translation: Indra, lord of the gods, having thought thus, caused the place where his blood was sprinkled to turn red sandalwood perfume into sandalwood fragrance with a hundred yojanas on its face.

source_sentence: 爾時帝釋天主，即讚常啼菩薩摩訶薩言：『善哉，善哉！
translation: It was then that Indra the lord of the gods praised the Ever Wailing Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, saying, 'Good, good!'

source_sentence: 善男子！
translation: Good sons!

source_sentence: 汝今為求無上法故發大精進，過去諸佛如來、應供、正等正覺本行菩薩道時，
亦如汝今等無有異。』
translation: It's no different from what you are now.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩復作是念：『法上菩薩摩訶薩當說法時，我無香華，
translation: At that time, the great bodhisattva Mahāsattva Ever Wailing also had this thought:

source_sentence: 將何供養？』
translation: What will I make an offering?'

source_sentence: 帝釋天主知所念已，即以千斛天曼陀羅華奉上常啼菩薩摩訶薩。
translation: Knowing what he thought, Indra the lord of the gods offered a thousand- cubit celestial maṇḍala flowers to the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Ever Wailing on top of him with a thousand- cubit heavenly maṇḍala.

source_sentence: 爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩受是華已，等分其半先散座側。
translation: After accepting these flowers, the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva distributes half of them equally to the side of his seat after he receives them.

source_sentence: 「爾時，法上菩薩摩訶薩，過是七歲已從三摩地出，還詣法座安處其上，
translation: “At that time, the great bodhisattva Mahāsattva Dharmâkara came out of samādhi after seven years had passed, returned to his Dharma seat, and settled there.

source_sentence: 與無數百千大眾恭敬圍繞。
translation: He was surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands of people who paid respect to him.

source_sentence: 時常啼菩薩摩訶薩見法上菩薩摩訶薩處于座已，心大歡喜，譬如苾芻得第三禪樂，
translation: When the Bodhisattva Mahāsattva Ever Wailing saw the bodhisattva Mahāsattva Dharmapāda seated on his seat, his heart was overjoyed, as if a monk had attained the bliss of the third meditation.

source_sentence: 即持帝釋所奉天曼陀羅華先所分者，向法上菩薩摩訶薩散擲供養已，合掌諦心聽受宣說般若波羅蜜多甚深正法。
translation: That's the first part of the celestial maṇḍala flower previously offered by Śakra Devānām-Indra, which is to be offered to the Dharma supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva after he joins his palms and listens with a concentrated mind to the profound teaching of the profound right teaching of the prajñāpāramitā.

source_sentence: 「爾時，法上菩薩摩訶薩因常啼菩薩摩訶薩故，謂諸眾言：『汝等當知！
translation: At the time, the Dharma Supreme Bodhisattva Mahāsattva, the eternally wailing bodhisattva Mahāsattva, said to the crowd, 'You should know!'

source_sentence: 一切法平等，般若波羅蜜多亦平等。
translation: All dharmas are equal, and the prajñāpāramitā is equal.

source_sentence: 一切法離，般若波羅蜜多亦離。
translation: All dharmas are free, and the prajñāpāramitā is also free.

source_sentence: 一切法無動，般若波羅蜜多亦無動。
translation: All dharmas are motionless, and the prajñāpāramitā is also motionless.

source_sentence: 一切法無念，般若波羅蜜多亦無念。
translation: All dharmas lack mindfulness, and the prajñāpāramitā also lacks mindfulness.

source_sentence: 一切法無畏，般若波羅蜜多亦無畏。
translation: All things are fearless, and the prajñāpāramitā is also fearless.

source_sentence: 一切法無味，般若波羅蜜多亦無味。
translation: All dharmas lack taste, and the prajñāpāramitā has no taste.

source_sentence: 一切法無邊，般若波羅蜜多亦無邊。
translation: All dharmas have no limit, and the prajñāpāramitā has no limit.

source_sentence: 一切法無生，般若波羅蜜多亦無生。
translation: All things lack birth, and the prajñāpāramitā also lacks birth.

source_sentence: 一切法無滅，般若波羅蜜多亦無滅。
translation: All dharmas have no cessation, and the prajñāpāramitā also has no cessation.

source_sentence: 虛空無邊，般若波羅蜜多亦無邊。
translation: Space has no limit, and the prajñāpāramitā has no limit.

source_sentence: 大海無邊，般若波羅蜜多亦無邊。
translation: The great ocean has no limit, and the prajñāpāramitā has no limit.

source_sentence: 須彌山莊嚴，般若波羅蜜多亦莊嚴。
translation: Mount Sumeru is adorned, and the prajñāpāramitā is also adorned.

source_sentence: 虛空無分別，般若波羅蜜多亦無分別。
translation: Space has no discrimination, and the prajñāpāramitā has no discrimination.

source_sentence: 色無邊，般若波羅蜜多亦無邊。
translation: Form has no limit, and the prajñāpāramitā has no limit.

source_sentence: 受、想、行、識無邊，般若波羅蜜多亦無邊。
translation: Feeling, perception, volition, volition, and consciousness are limitless, and the prajñāpāramitā is also limitless.

source_sentence: 地界無邊，般若波羅蜜多亦無邊。
translation: The earth realm has no limit, and the prajñāpāramitā has no limit.

source_sentence: 水界、火界、風界、空界、識界無邊，般若波羅蜜多亦無邊。
translation: The water element, fire element, wind element, air element, space element, and consciousness element are limitless, and the prajñāpāramitā is also limitless.

source_sentence: 金剛喻法平等，般若波羅蜜多亦平等。
translation: The adamantine metaphor of the Dharma is equal, and the prajñāpāramitā is equal.

source_sentence: 一切法無分別，般若波羅蜜多亦無分別。
translation: All dharmas are without discrimination, and the prajñāpāramitā is also without discrimination.

source_sentence: 一切法無所得，般若波羅蜜多亦無所得。
translation: All dharmas lack attainment, and the prajñāpāramitā also lacks attainment.

source_sentence: 一切法平等無性，般若波羅蜜多亦平等無性。
translation: All dharmas are equal and without nature, and the prajñāpāramitā is equal and without nature.

source_sentence: 一切法無壞，般若波羅蜜多亦無壞。
translation: All dharmas are not broken, and the prajñāpāramitā is not broken either.

source_sentence: 一切法不可思議，般若波羅蜜多亦不可思議。』
translation: All dharmas are inconceivable, and the perfection of wisdom is also inconceivable.'

source_sentence: 「爾時，常啼菩薩摩訶薩聞是法已，即於會中得入一切法平等三摩地，
translation: “At that time, the great bodhisattva Ever Wailing, having heard this teaching, entered into the concentration of equanimity regarding all things.

source_sentence: 一切法離三摩地，一切法無動三摩地，一切法無念三摩地，一切法無畏三摩地，
translation: All things are free from concentration, all things are unmoving concentration, all things are thoughtless concentration, and all things are fearless concentration.

source_sentence: 一切法無味三摩地，一切法無邊三摩地，一切法無生三摩地，一切法無滅三摩地，
translation: The concentration on the tastelessness of all things, the concentration on the boundlessness of all things, the concentration on the nonorigination of all things, and the concentration on the cessation of all things.

source_sentence: 虛空無邊三摩地，大海無邊三摩地，須彌山莊嚴三摩地，虛空無分別三摩地，
translation: boundless concentration in space, boundless concentration in the great ocean, boundless concentration in the polar mountain, boundless concentration in space, boundless concentration in space, boundless concentration in space,

source_sentence: 色無邊三摩地，受、想、行、識無邊三摩地，地界無邊三摩地，水、火、風、空、識界無邊三摩地，
translation: boundless concentration of form, boundless concentration of feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness, boundless concentration of the earth realm, boundless concentration of water, fire, air, space, and consciousness realms,

source_sentence: 金剛喻法平等三摩地，一切法無分別三摩地，一切法無所得三摩地，一切法平等無性三摩地，
translation: adamantine concentration on the equality of all dharmas, nondiscriminating concentration on all dharmas, ungraspable concentration on all dharmas, and essenceless concentration on the equality of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 一切法無壞三摩地，一切法不可思議三摩地。
translation: It's the indestructible samādhi of all dharmas and the inconceivable samādhi of all dharmas.

source_sentence: 常啼菩薩摩訶薩得入如是等六萬三摩地門，於是諸三摩地中得見十方如兢伽沙數三千大千世界如兢伽沙數諸佛世尊，
translation: The bodhisattva Mahāsattva Ever Wailing found these sixty thousand great one-thousand doors of concentration, and within those doors he saw as many buddhas in the ten directions as there are grains of sand in the polar mountain.

source_sentence: 各與菩薩、聲聞、人、天大眾，以如是名字如是章句，宣說般若波羅蜜多。
translation: Each of them and the bodhisattvas, śrāvakas, humans, and celestial masses proclaimed the prajñāpāramitā with such names and phrases.

source_sentence: 如法上菩薩摩訶薩今此會中有諸大眾恭敬圍繞，以如是名字如是章句，
translation: In this assembly, the great bodhisattva Mahāsattva Upāsaka of the Dharma is surrounded by an assembly of disciples and venerated with these names and phrases.

source_sentence: 宣說般若波羅蜜多，等無有異。」
translation: There's no difference between proclaiming the perfection of prajñāpāramitā and equality.

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告須菩提言：「如我所說，彼常啼菩薩摩訶薩以如是等種種方便精進堅固，
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Subhūti, saying: Just as I have explained, these bodhisattvas and mahāsattvas Ever Wailing, who are steadfast in such various means of liberation,

source_sentence: 勤求般若波羅蜜多。
translation: They diligently seek the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 而彼菩薩於彼法上菩薩摩訶薩所，得聞般若波羅蜜多，得入諸三摩地門，
translation: And those bodhisattvas hear the perfection of wisdom from the supreme bodhisattva Mahāsattva in that Dharma and enter all the doors of concentration.

source_sentence: 從三摩地出已即得多聞具足，如大海水深廣無邊，於現生中常得見佛，
translation: Having emerged from concentration, he is endowed with a great deal of learning. Like the water in the great ocean whose depth and breadth are boundless, he always sees buddhas in his present life.

source_sentence: 世世所生生諸佛剎，乃至於剎那間亦不暫離諸佛世尊。
translation: The buddha-lands that arise from generation to generation and the buddhas that arise from generation don't part momentarily from the world-honored buddhas, even for an instant.

source_sentence: 須菩提！
translation: Subhūti!

source_sentence: 當知求般若波羅蜜多者，有如是等功德利益。
translation: You should know that someone who seeks the perfection of wisdom has such merits and benefits.

source_sentence: 是故今我法中菩薩摩訶薩諸求般若波羅蜜多者，亦應如是求。」
translation: That's why the bodhisattvas, mahāsattvas, and those who seek the perfection of wisdom in my teaching should also thus seek it.

source_sentence: 囑累品第三十二
translation: Chapter Thirty-second of the Entrustment

source_sentence: 爾時，佛告尊者阿難言：「汝今當知，般若波羅蜜多者是諸佛母，出生諸佛一切智智。
translation: It was then that the Buddha addressed Venerable Ānanda, saying, Now, you should know that the prajñāpāramitā is the mother of all buddhas and gives rise to the omniscience of all buddhas.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若欲行般若波羅蜜多者，應當於此甚深正法受持讀誦、記念思惟、為人演說，
translation: Those who want to practice the perfection of wisdom should memorize, recite, remember, contemplate, and explain this profound teaching for others.

source_sentence: 乃至書寫一句一偈置清淨處，以寶函盛尊重恭敬，即以種種金銀珍寶、香華燈塗、幢幡寶蓋等廣大供養，
translation: Even if he were to write a single phrase or verse and place it in a pure place, with a precious casket full of reverence and respect, he would make vast offerings of various kinds of gold, silver, rare treasures, fragrant flowers, lamps, paints, banners, pennants, jeweled canopies, and so forth.

source_sentence: 乃至一香一華一禮一讚，隨其所應恭敬供養。
translation: It's even a fragrance, a flower, a salute, or a praise that should be offered with respect and offerings according to their needs.

source_sentence: 當知是人則受我教，我所稱讚。
translation: You should know that this person will then accept my teaching and be praised by me.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 佛是汝大師不？」
translation: Is the Buddha your teacher?

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 佛是我大師！
translation: The Buddha is my great teacher!

source_sentence: 我是佛弟子。」
translation: I am a disciple of the Buddha.

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝今是我弟子，汝於現世給侍恭敬尊重於我，我涅槃後，汝當恭敬尊重供養此般若波羅蜜多甚深正法，
translation: You are now my disciple, and in the present life you serve me with respect and reverence. After my nirvana you should venerate and honor me and offer support to this profound teaching of the perfection of wisdom.

source_sentence: 是即恭敬尊重於我，是為最大報佛恩者。
translation: This is the greatest way to repay the Buddha's kindness.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 我今以是般若波羅蜜多甚深正法付囑於汝，汝當受持慎勿忘失，宣通流布使不斷絕。
translation: Now, I'll entrust this profound right teaching of the perfection of wisdom to you, so you must retain it, be careful not to forget it, and spread it without stopping it.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 汝當精進助宣此法，莫作末後斷佛種人。」
translation: You must make effort to help proclaim this teaching, so that you won't become a person who ends up cutting off the buddha seed afterward.

source_sentence: 第二第三如是囑累。
translation: The second and third are thus instructed.

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「如世尊勅，我當奉持。
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, As the Bhagavān had instructed me, I will uphold it.

source_sentence: 如世尊勅，我當奉持。」
translation: As the Bhagavān commands, I will uphold it.

source_sentence: 如是三白已。
translation: After these three statements, he said.

source_sentence: 佛言：「阿難！
translation: The Buddha said, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 當知隨爾所時此般若波羅蜜多正法在世，即爾所時諸佛世尊在世說法。
translation: You should know that whenever this true teaching of the prajñāpāramitā is present in the world, the Bhagavān and the buddhas are present in the world to teach it.

source_sentence: 又復，阿難！
translation: Again, Ānanda!

source_sentence: 若有善男子、善女人於此般若波羅蜜多甚深正法，愛樂恭敬、受持讀誦、記念思惟、為人演說，
translation: “Furthermore, if there are sons and daughters of a virtuous family who take delight in this profound teaching of the transcendent wisdom-prajñāpāramitā (i.e., the principle of enlightenment), they will preserve it, recite it, remember it, contemplate it, and explain it to others.

source_sentence: 乃至書寫尊重供養者，當知是善男子、善女人，世世所生常得見佛聽受正法。」
translation: Even those who write and honor and make offerings should know that these are good men and good women who are born in the world will always see the Buddha and hear and accept the right teaching.

source_sentence: 佛說此經已，慈氏等諸菩薩摩訶薩，尊者須菩提、尊者舍利子、尊者阿難等諸大聲聞眾，
translation: After the Buddha had taught this sutra, the great śrāvakas such as Maitreya, Venerable Subhūti, Venerable Śāriputra, and Venerable Ānanda were present.

source_sentence: 并帝釋天主等，乃至一切世間天、人、阿修羅等，聞佛所說，皆大歡喜，
translation: All the gods, humans, and asuras who heard these teachings of the Buddha were greatly delighted.

source_sentence: 信受奉行。
translation: They believe and accept it and venerate it.

source_sentence: 佛說佛母出生三法藏般若波羅蜜多經卷第二十五
translation: Foshuo fomu give birth to the three collections of teachings, prajñāpāramitā jing, vol. 25
